The concept Mollusca  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/mollusca  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Animalia->Mollusca
Definition:
animals that have a soft body with a mantle, a radula (ribbon-like structure covered in tiny teeth that is used to scrape food), a muscular foot, an open circulatory system, and a visceral mass that contains the internal organs, including the digestive, excretory, and reproductive systems. (ChatGPT)
Alternate labels:
bivalves, cephalopods, gastropods

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Other invertebrate

The concept Other invertebrate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/otherinvertebrate  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Animalia->Other invertebrate
Definition:
Includes Cnidaria (jellyfish, coral, anemones), Echinodermata (starfish, sea urchins, sea cucumbers), Nematoda (roundworms), Platyhelminthes (flatworms), Annelida (segmented worms), Ctenophora (comb jellies), Brachiopoda (lamp shells), Bryozoa (moss animals), Chaetognatha (arrow worms), Hemichordata (acorn worms), Xenacoelomorpha (simple-bodied worms) (ChatGPT)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Porifera

The concept Porifera  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/porifera  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Animalia->Porifera
Definition:
multicellular animals that have bodies full of pores and channels allowing water to circulate through them, consisting of jelly-like mesohyl sandwiched between two thin layers of cells. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sponge)
Alternate labels:
sponges

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Fungi

The concept Fungi  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/Fungi  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Fungi
Immediately narrower concepts:
Macrofungi, Microfungi
Definition:
eukaryotic organisms that contain chitin in their cell walls, are heterotrophs (they obtain their nutrients by absorbing organic material from their environment, either as decomposers, parasites, or symbionts) , lack chloroplasts, reproduce both sexually and asexually, and can take on a variety of growth forms, including single-celled yeasts, multicellular molds, and complex, specialized fruiting bodies. (ChatGPT)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Macrofungi

The concept Macrofungi  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/macrofungi  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Fungi->Macrofungi
Definition:
Macrofungi refers to all fungi that produce visible fruiting bodies. These fungi are evolutionarily and ecologically very divergent. Evolutionarily, they belong to two main phyla, Ascomycota and Basidiomycota, and many of them have relatives that cannot form visible fruiting bodies.(https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6106070/)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Microfungi

The concept Microfungi  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/microfungi  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Fungi->Microfungi
Definition:
Microfungi or micromycetes are fungi—eukaryotic organisms such as molds, mildews and rusts, which have microscopic spore-producing structures. They exhibit tube tip-growth and have cell walls composed of chitin, a polymer of N-acetylglucosamine. Microfungi are a paraphyletic group, distinguished from macrofungi only by the absence of a large, multicellular fruiting body. Include moulds, yeasts. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microfungi)
Alternate labels:
micromycetes

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Plantae

The concept Plantae  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/Plantae  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Plantae
Immediately narrower concepts:
Bryophyte, Other plant, Pteridophyte, Seed plant
Definition:
Plants are eukaryotes that have cell walls made of cellulose, specialized organelles called chloroplasts, which contain chlorophyll and other pigments that allow plants to perform photosynthesis and produce their own food; a unique life cycle that involves alternating between a haploid gametophyte stage and a diploid sporophyte stage; specialized regions called apical meristems at the tips of their roots and shoots, which allow for growth and the development of new tissues; specialized structures for reproduction, including flowers, cones, and spores, and most plants have specialized tissues called xylem and phloem, which transport water, nutrients, and other substances throughout the plant. (ChatGPT)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Bryophyte

The concept Bryophyte  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/bryophyte  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Plantae->Bryophyte
Definition:
Non-vascular plants that do not have specialized tissues for transporting water and nutrients; includes mosses, Marchantiophyta (liverworts), and Anthocerotophyta (hornworts). (ChatGPT)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Other plant

The concept Other plant  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/otherplant  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Plantae->Other plant
Definition:
plants that do not fit in other plant sub class. Includes Lycopodiophyta (clubmosses) and Equisetophyta (horsetails)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Pteridophyte

The concept Pteridophyte  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/pteridophyte  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Plantae->Pteridophyte
Definition:
a vascular plant (with xylem and phloem) that disperses spores; they produce neither flowers nor seeds, Includes Ferns, horsetails (often treated as ferns), and lycophytes (clubmosses, spikemosses, and quillworts)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Seed plant

The concept Seed plant  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/spermatophyte  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Plantae->Seed plant
Definition:
Plant that produces seeds, hence the alternative name seed plant. Spermatophytes are a subset of the embryophytes or land plants. They include most familiar types of plants, including all flowers and most trees, but exclude some other types of plants such as ferns, mosses, algae. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spermatophyte). Includes Gymnosperms (naked-seed plants) and Angiosperms (flowering plants).
Alternate labels:
spermatophyte

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Protista

The concept Protista  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/Protista  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Protista
Immediately narrower concepts:
Amoebozoa, Protozoa
Definition:
any organism whose cells contain a cell nucleus (a eucaryote) that is not an animal, plant, or fungus. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protist). Protista is not a specific taxonomic group, but a term that historically referred to a group of eukaryotic organisms that did not fit into the other kingdoms of plants, animals, and fungi. (ChatGPT)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Amoebozoa

The concept Amoebozoa  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/amoebozoa  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Protista->Amoebozoa
Immediately narrower concepts:
Myxomycetes
Definition:
a diverse group of organisms that share certain characteristics, such as the ability to move using pseudopodia, temporary extensions of the cell membrane and cytoplasm that allow the cell to crawl or engulf food particles, the lack of rigid cell walls, presence of mitochondria, which are organelles that generate energy for the cell through cellular respiration (chatGPT)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Myxomycetes

The concept Myxomycetes  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/myxomycete  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Protista->Amoebozoa->Myxomycetes
Definition:
Aclass of slime molds. All species pass through several, very different morphologic phases, such as microscopic individual cells, slimy amorphous organisms visible with the naked eye and conspicuously shaped fruit bodies. Although they are monocellular, they can reach immense widths and weights. Some consider the Myxomycota to be a separate kingdom, with an unsettled phylogeny because of conflicting molecular and developmental data. The relations among Myxogastrid orders are as yet unclear. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mycetozoa). Mycetozoa includes the slime molds, which are a group of organisms that have both amoeboid and fungal-like characteristics. The Mycetozoa can be further subdivided into two groups: the plasmodial slime molds and the cellular slime molds. Myxomycetes are unique among the Amoebozoa in that they have a complex life cycle involving the formation of spore-bearing structures called fruiting bodies, which is a key feature that distinguishes them from other amoebae. (ChatGPT)
Alternate labels:
Mycetozoa

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Protozoa

The concept Protozoa  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/protozoa  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Protista->Protozoa
Definition:
A single-celled eukaryote, either free-living or parasitic, that feed on organic matter such as other microorganisms or organic tissues and debris. Historically, protozoans were regarded as ‘one-celled animals’, because they often possess animal-like behaviours, such as motility and predation, and lack a cell wall, as found in plants and many algae. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protozoa)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Algae

The concept Algae  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/algae  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Algae
Definition:
informal term for a large and diverse group of photosynthetic eukaryotic organisms. Included organisms range from unicellular microalgae, such as Chlorella, Prototheca and the diatoms, to multicellular forms, such as the giant kelp, a large brown alga which may grow up to 50 metres (160 ft) in length. Most are aquatic and autotrophic (they generate food internally) and lack many of the distinct cell and tissue types, such as stomata, xylem and phloem that are found in land plants. Includes red algae (Rhodophycophyta), brown algae (Phaeophycophyta), and green algae (Chlorophycophyta). https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algae

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Eukaryotic microorganisms

The concept Eukaryotic microorganisms  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/eukaryoticmicroorganisms  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Eukaryote->Eukaryotic microorganisms
Definition:
Eukaryote single-cell organisms that does not fit in one of the other classes.

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Lichen

The concept Lichen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/lichen  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Lichen
Definition:
A composite organism that arises from algae or cyanobacteria living among filaments of multiple fungi species in a mutualistic relationship. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lichen). Lichens are not classified under a specific kingdom as they are a symbiotic association between a fungus and either an alga or a cyanobacterium. The fungal partner belongs to the kingdom Fungi, while the algal or cyanobacterial partner belongs to either the kingdom Plantae or the kingdom Bacteria, respectively. (ChatGPT)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Plasmid

The concept Plasmid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/plasmid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Plasmid
Definition:
A plasmid is a small, extrachromosomal DNA molecule within a cell that is physically separated from chromosomal DNA and can replicate independently. While chromosomes are large and contain all the essential genetic information for living under normal conditions, plasmids are usually very small and contain only additional genes that may be useful in certain situations or conditions. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plasmid)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Prokaryote

The concept Prokaryote  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/prokaryote  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Prokaryote
Immediately narrower concepts:
Archaea, Bacteria
Definition:
single-celled organisms that lack a nucleus and other membrane-bound organelles. Unlike cells of animals and other eukaryotes, bacterial cells do not contain a nucleus and rarely harbour membrane-bound organelles. Molecular systematics showed prokaryotic life to consist of two separate domains, originally called Eubacteria and Archaebacteria, but now called Bacteria and Archaea that evolved independently from an ancient common ancestor. Almost all prokaryotes have a cell wall, a protective structure that allows them to survive in extreme conditions, which is located outside of their plasma membrane. Archaea and bacteria cannot reproduce sexually.
Alternate labels:
Monera

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Archaea

The concept Archaea  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/archaea  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Prokaryote->Archaea
Definition:
archaeal cell walls are composed of polysaccharides (sugars). they never have peptidoglycan in their cell walls, their cell membranes contain lipids of unique composition (glycerol molecules are mirror images of those found in other cells, and form ether linkages to isoprenoid side chains), and their 16S ribosomal- RNA nucleotide sequences are unlike those of bacteria. (https://quizlet.com/234154298/archaea-and-bacteria-flash-cards/). The common characteristics of Archaebacteria known to date are these: (1) the presence of characteristic tRNAs and ribosomal RNAs; (2) the absence of peptidoglycan cell walls, with in many cases, replacement by a largely proteinaceous coat; (3) the occurrence of ether linked lipids built from phytanyl chains and (4) in all cases known so far, their occurrence only in unusual habitats. (https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/691075/)
Alternate labels:
Archaebacteria

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Bacteria

The concept Bacteria  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/bacteria  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Prokaryote->Bacteria
Definition:
a large domain of prokaryotic microorganisms. Bacterial cells do not contain a nucleus and rarely harbour membrane-bound organelles. The bacterial cell is surrounded by a cell membrane, which is made primarily of phospholipids. This membrane encloses the contents of the cell and acts as a barrier to hold nutrients, proteins and other essential components of the cytoplasm within the cell. Bacterial cell walls are composed of peptidoglycan, a complex of protein and sugars, while archaeal cell walls are composed of polysaccharides (sugars). (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacteria)
Alternate labels:
Eubacteria

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Virus

The concept Virus  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/virus  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Virus
Immediately narrower concepts:
Other Virus, Phage
Definition:
A virus is a submicroscopic infectious agent that replicates only inside the living cells of an organism. Realms are Adnaviria, Duplodnaviria, Monodnaviria, Riboviria, Ribozyviria, Varidnaviria (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virus). Viruses are not cells at all, so they are neither prokaryotes nor eukaryotes. (https://bio.libretexts.org/Bookshelves/Introductory_and_General_Biology/Book)

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Other Virus

The concept Other Virus  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/othervirus  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Virus->Other Virus
Definition:
Virus that is not a member of order Caudovirales (e.g., bacteriophage T4, lambda phage).

title: Biology Extension: Basic taxon classes for biological entity
text:
Phage

The concept Phage  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/phage  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/biology/biosampledfeature/1.0/biologicentityvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Biological entity->Virus->Phage
Definition:
A bacteriophage, also known informally as a phage, is a duplodnaviria virus that infects and replicates within bacteria and archaea. Bacteriophages are composed of proteins that encapsulate a DNA or RNA genome, and may have structures that are either simple or elaborate. Their genomes may encode as few as four genes (e.g. MS2) and as many as hundreds of genes. Phages replicate within the bacterium following the injection of their genome into its cytoplasm. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacteriophage). Includes all virus in order Caudovirales (e.g., bacteriophage T4, lambda phage).
Alternate labels:
bacteriophage

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Vocabularies and extensions:
History:
Concept Hierarchy:

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
mineral

The concept mineral  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/material/1.0/mineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/material/1.0/materialsvocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Mineral-Borate, Mineral-Carbonate or Nitrate, Mineral-Halide, Mineral-Native Element, Mineral-Organic Compound, Mineral-Oxide, Mineral-Phosphate, Arsenate, or Vanadate, Mineral-Silicate or Germanate, Mineral-Sulfate, Selenate, or Tellurate, Mineral-Sulfide or Sulfosalt
Definition:
Material consists of a single mineral or mineraloid phase. . ‘A mineral is an element or chemical compound that is normally crystalline and that has been formed as a result of geological processes.’ (Nickel, Ernest H. (1995), The definition of a mineral, The Canadian Mineralogist. 33 (3): 689–90). Include mineraloids. … A material primarily composed of some substance that is naturally occurring, solid and stable at room temperature, representable by a chemical formula, usually abiogenic, and that has an ordered atomic structure. (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01000256). Comment: the identity of a mineral species is defined by a crystal structure and a chemical composition that might include various specific elemental substitutions in that structure. Mineraloid: A naturally occurring mineral-like substance that does not demonstrate crystallinity. Mineraloids possess chemical compositions that vary beyond the generally accepted ranges for specific minerals. Examples: obsidian, Opal. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mineraloid)

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Borate

The concept Mineral-Borate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/boratemineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Borate
Definition:
Minerals which contain a borate anion group.
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 06

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Carbonate or Nitrate

The concept Mineral-Carbonate or Nitrate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/carbonatenitratemineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Carbonate or Nitrate
Definition:
Carbonate minerals are those minerals containing the carbonate ion
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 05

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Halide

The concept Mineral-Halide  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/halidemineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Halide
Definition:
Minerals with a dominant halide anion.
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 03

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Native Element

The concept Mineral-Native Element  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/nativeelementmineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Native Element
Definition:
Elements that occur in nature in uncombined form with a distinct mineral structure. Includes metals and intermetallic alloys; metalloids and nonmetals; carbides, silicides, nitrides, phosphides
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 01

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Organic Compound

The concept Mineral-Organic Compound  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/organicmineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Organic Compound
Definition:
Salts of organic acids, hydrocarbons, and miscellaneous organic minerals formed as a result of geological processes. Includes hydrocarbons, formates, acetates, oxalates, benzine salts, cyanates. Chemical compounds in which one or more atoms of carbon are covalently linked to atoms of other elements, most commonly hydrogen, oxygen, or nitrogen (https://www.britannica.com/science/organic-compound).
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 10, Organic mineral

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Oxide

The concept Mineral-Oxide  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/oxidemineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Oxide
Definition:
Includes class oxides, hydroxides, and arsenties. Oxides are minerals in which the oxide anion is bonded to one or more metal alloys. The hydroxide-bearing minerals are typically included in the oxide class. Arsenite minerals are very rare oxygen-bearing arsenic minerals.
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 04

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Phosphate, Arsenate, or Vanadate

The concept Mineral-Phosphate, Arsenate, or Vanadate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/phosphatearsenatevanadatemineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Phosphate, Arsenate, or Vanadate
Definition:
Phosphate minerals contain the phosphate anion along sometimes with arsenate and vanadate substitutions, and chloride, fluoride, and hydroxide anions that also fit into the crystal structure. Arsenate minerals usually refer to the naturally occurring orthoarsenates.
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 08

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Silicate or Germanate

The concept Mineral-Silicate or Germanate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/silicategermanatemineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Silicate or Germanate
Definition:
Rock-forming minerals made up of silicate groups
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 09

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Sulfate, Selenate, or Tellurate

The concept Mineral-Sulfate, Selenate, or Tellurate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/sulfateselenatetelluratemineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Sulfate, Selenate, or Tellurate
Definition:
class of minerals that include the sulfate ion within their structure.
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 07

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Mineral group vocabulary
text:
Mineral-Sulfide or Sulfosalt

The concept Mineral-Sulfide or Sulfosalt  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/sulfidesulfosaltmineral  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/mingroup/1.0/mineralgroupvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  mineral->Mineral-Sulfide or Sulfosalt
Definition:
Sulfide minerals are a class of minerals containing sulfide or disulfide as the major anion. Sulfosalt minerals are those complex sulfide minerals with the general formula: AmBnSp; where A represents a metal such as copper, lead, silver, iron, and rarely mercury, zinc, vanadium; B usually represents semi-metal such as arsenic, antimony, bismuth, and rarely germanium, or metals like tin and rarely vanadium; and S is sulfur or rarely selenium or/and tellurium (m, n, and p are integer formula subscripts). Includes sulfides, selenides, tellurides; arsenides, antimonides, bismuthides; sulfarsenites, sulfantimonites, sulfbismuthites
Alternate labels:
Nickel-Strunz class 02

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
Vocabularies and extensions:
History:
2024-01-06 SMR updates to validate with SHACL rules in isamples/vocab_tools repo; extension vocabulary in skos:inScheme isamples parent voabularty; properties on inherited classes from iSample parent.
Concept Hierarchy:

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
Rock

The concept Rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/material/1.0/rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
aphanite, breccia, fault related material, fragmental igneous rock, igneous rock, impact generated material, massive sulphide, metamorphic rock, metasomatic rock, sedimentary rock, tuffit, residual material
Definition:
Consolidated aggregate of particles (grains) of rock, mineral (including native elements), mineraloid, or solid organic material. Includes mineral aggregates such as granite, shale, marble; natural glass such as obsidian; organic material formed by geologic processes such a coal; extraterrestrial material in meteorites; and crushed rock fragments like drill cuttings from rock. (based on http://resource.geosciml.org/classifier/cgi/lithology/rock, same as http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001995)

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
aphanite

The concept aphanite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Aphanite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->aphanite
Definition:
Rock that is too fine grained to categorize in more detail.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
breccia

The concept breccia  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Breccia  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->breccia
Definition:
Coarse-grained material composed of angular broken rock fragments; the fragments typically have sharp edges and unworn corners. The fragments may be held together by a mineral cement or in a fine-grained matrix, and consolidated or nonconsolidated. Clasts may be of any composition or origin. In sedimentary environments, breccia is used for material that consists entirely of angular fragments, mostly derived from a single source rock body, as in a rock avalanche deposit, and matrix is interpreted to be the product of comminution of clasts during transport. Diamictite or diamicton is used when the material reflects mixing of rock from a variety of sources, some sub angular or subrounded clasts may be present, and matrix is pre-existing fine grained material that is not a direct product of the brecciation/deposition process.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
fault related material

The concept fault related material  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Fault_Related_Material  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->fault related material
Immediately narrower concepts:
cataclasite series, mylonitic rock, breccia gouge series
Definition:
Material formed as a result brittle faulting, composed of greater than 10 percent matrix; matrix is fine-grained material caused by tectonic grainsize reduction. Includes cohesive (cataclasite series, mylonitic rocks) and non-cohesive (breccia-gouge series) material.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
cataclasite series

The concept cataclasite series  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Cataclasite_Series  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->fault related material->cataclasite series
Definition:
Fault-related rock that maintained primary cohesion during deformation, with matrix comprising greater than 10 percent of rock mass; matrix is fine-grained material formed through grain size reduction by fracture as opposed to crystal plastic process that operate in mylonitic rock. Includes cataclasite, protocataclasite and ultracataclasite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
mylonitic rock

The concept mylonitic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Mylonitic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->fault related material->mylonitic rock
Definition:
Metamorphic rock characterised by a foliation resulting from tectonic grain size reduction, in which more than 10 percent of the rock volume has undergone grain size reduction. Includes protomylonite, mylonite, ultramylonite, and blastomylonite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
breccia gouge series

The concept breccia gouge series  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/breccia_gouge_series  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->fault related material->breccia gouge series
Definition:
Fault-related material with features such as void spaces (filled or unfilled), or unconsolidated matrix material between fragments, indicating loss of cohesion during deformation. Includes fault-related breccia and gouge.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
fragmental igneous rock

The concept fragmental igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Fragmental_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->Rock->igneous rock->fragmental igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
pyroclastic rock
Definition:
Igneous rock in which greater than 75 percent of the rock consists of fragments produced as a result of igneous rock-forming process. Includes pyroclastic rocks, autobreccia associated with lava flows and intrusive breccias. Excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes (see Tuffite)

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
pyroclastic rock

The concept pyroclastic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Pyroclastic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->Rock->igneous rock->fragmental igneous rock->pyroclastic rock
Definition:
Fragmental igneous rock that consists of greater than 75 percent fragments produced as a direct result of eruption or extrusion of magma from within the earth onto its surface. Includes autobreccia associated with lava flows and excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
igneous rock

The concept igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
acidic igneous rock, basic igneous rock, doleritic rock, exotic composition igneous rock, fine grained igneous rock, fragmental igneous rock, glass rich igneous rock, hypabyssal intrusive rock, intermediate composition igneous rock, phaneritic igneous rock, plutonic rock, porphyry, ultrabasic igneous rock, ultramafic igneous rock, volcanic rock
Definition:
rock formed as a result of igneous processes, for example intrusion and cooling of magma in the crust, or volcanic eruption.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
acidic igneous rock

The concept acidic igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Acidic_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
dacite, granitoid, quartz rich igneous rock, rhyolitoid
Definition:
Igneous rock with more than 63 percent SiO2.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
dacite

The concept dacite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Dacite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->dacite
Definition:
Fine grained or porphyritic crystalline rock that contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals, between 20 and 60 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction, and has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio greater than 0.65. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 4 and 5 or chemically in TAS Field O3. Typically composed of quartz and sodic plagioclase with minor amounts of biotite and/or hornblende and/or pyroxene; fine-grained equivalent of granodiorite and tonalite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
granitoid

The concept granitoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Granitoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid
Immediately narrower concepts:
alkali feldspar granite, granite, granodiorite, tonalite
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and/or plagioclase. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2, 3, 4 and 5 as alkali feldspar granite, granite, granodiorite or tonalite.
Alternate labels:
granitic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
alkali feldspar granite

The concept alkali feldspar granite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Alkali_Feldspar_Granite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->alkali feldspar granite
Definition:
Granitic rock that has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio less than 0.1. QAPF field 2.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
granite

The concept granite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Granite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->granite
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and plagioclase (typically sodic) in variable amounts, usually with biotite and/or hornblende. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 3.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
granodiorite

The concept granodiorite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Granodiorite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->granodiorite
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting essentially of quartz, sodic plagioclase and lesser amounts of alkali feldspar with minor hornblende and biotite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 4.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
tonalite

The concept tonalite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Tonalite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->tonalite
Definition:
Granitoid consisting of quartz and intermediate plagioclase, usually with biotite and amphibole. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 5; ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is greater than 0.9.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
quartz rich igneous rock

The concept quartz rich igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Quartz_Rich_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->quartz rich igneous rock
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock that contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals and contains greater than 60 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
rhyolitoid

The concept rhyolitoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Rhyolitoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->rhyolitoid
Definition:
fine_grained_igneous_rock consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar, with minor plagioclase and biotite, in a microcrystalline, cryptocrystalline or glassy groundmass. Flow texture is common. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2 and 3 or chemically in TAS Field R as rhyolite. QAPF normative definition is based on modal mineralogy thus: less than 90 percent mafic minerals, between 20 and 60 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction, and ratio of plagioclse to total feldspar is less than 0.65.
Alternate labels:
rhyolitic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
basic igneous rock

The concept basic igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Basic_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->basic igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
basalt, gabbroic rock
Definition:
Igneous rock with between 45 and 52 percent SiO2.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
basalt

The concept basalt  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Basalt  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->basic igneous rock->basalt
Definition:
Fine-grained or porphyritic igneous rock with less than 20 percent quartz, and less than 10 percent feldspathoid minerals, in which the ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is greater 0.65. Typically composed of calcic plagioclase and clinopyroxene; phenocrysts typically include one or more of calcic plagioclase, clinopyroxene, orthopyroxene, and olivine. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field B as basalt. Basalt and andesite are distinguished chemically based on silica content, with basalt defined to contain less than 52 weight percent silica. If chemical data are not available, the color index is used to distinguish the categories, with basalt defined to contain greater than 35 percent mafic minerals by volume or greater than 40 percent mafic minerals by weight.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
gabbroic rock

The concept gabbroic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Gabbroic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->gabbroid->Rock->igneous rock->basic igneous rock->gabbroic rock
Definition:
Gabbroid that has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio greater than 0.9 in the QAPF fraction. Includes QAPF fields 10*, 10, and 10’. This category includes the various categories defined in LeMaitre et al. (2002) based on the mafic mineralogy, but apparently not subdivided based on the quartz/feldspathoid content.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
doleritic rock

The concept doleritic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Doleritic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->doleritic rock
Definition:
Dark colored gabbroic (basaltic) or dioritic (andesitic) rock intermediate in grain size between basalt and gabbro and composed of plagioclase, pyroxene and opaque minerals; often with ophitic texture. Typically occurs as hypabyssal intrusions. Includes dolerite, microdiorite, diabase and microgabbro.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
exotic composition igneous rock

The concept exotic composition igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Exotic_Composition_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->exotic composition igneous rock
Definition:
Rock with ‘exotic’ mineralogical, textural or field setting characteristics; typically dark colored, with abundant phenocrysts. Criteria include: presence of greater than 10 percent melilite or leucite, or presence of kalsilite, or greater than 50 percent carbonate minerals. Includes Carbonatite, Melilitic rock, Kalsilitic rocks, Kimberlite, Lamproite, Leucitic rock and Lamprophyres.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
fine grained igneous rock

The concept fine grained igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Fine_Grained_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
andesite, basalt, dacite, foiditoid, high magnesium fine grained igneous rock, phonolitoid, rhyolitoid, tephritoid, trachytoid
Definition:
Igneous rock in which the framework of the rock consists of crystals that are too small to determine mineralogy with the unaided eye; framework may include up to 50 percent glass. A significant percentage of the rock by volume may be phenocrysts. Includes rocks that are generally called volcanic rocks.
Alternate labels:
volcanic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
andesite

The concept andesite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Andesite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->intermediate composition igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->andesite
Definition:
Fine-grained igneous rock with less than 20 percent quartz and less than 10 percent feldspathoid minerals in the QAPF fraction, in which the ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is greater 0.65. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field O2 as andesite. Basalt and andesite, which share the same QAPF fields, are distinguished chemically based on silica content, with basalt defined to contain less than 52 weight percent silica. If chemical data are not available, the color index is used to distinguish the categories, with basalt defined to contain greater than 35 percent mafic minerals by volume or greater than 40 percent mafic minerals by weight. Typically consists of plagioclase (frequently zoned from labradorite to oligoclase), pyroxene, hornblende and/or biotite. Fine grained equivalent of dioritic rock.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
basalt

The concept basalt  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Basalt  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->basic igneous rock->basalt
Definition:
Fine-grained or porphyritic igneous rock with less than 20 percent quartz, and less than 10 percent feldspathoid minerals, in which the ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is greater 0.65. Typically composed of calcic plagioclase and clinopyroxene; phenocrysts typically include one or more of calcic plagioclase, clinopyroxene, orthopyroxene, and olivine. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field B as basalt. Basalt and andesite are distinguished chemically based on silica content, with basalt defined to contain less than 52 weight percent silica. If chemical data are not available, the color index is used to distinguish the categories, with basalt defined to contain greater than 35 percent mafic minerals by volume or greater than 40 percent mafic minerals by weight.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
dacite

The concept dacite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Dacite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->dacite
Definition:
Fine grained or porphyritic crystalline rock that contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals, between 20 and 60 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction, and has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio greater than 0.65. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 4 and 5 or chemically in TAS Field O3. Typically composed of quartz and sodic plagioclase with minor amounts of biotite and/or hornblende and/or pyroxene; fine-grained equivalent of granodiorite and tonalite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
foiditoid

The concept foiditoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Foiditoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->foiditoid
Definition:
Fine grained crystalline rock containing less than 90 percent mafic minerals and more than 60 percent feldspathoid minerals in the QAPF fraction. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 15 or chemically in TAS field F.
Alternate labels:
foidite (sensu lato), foiditic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
section: high magnesium fine grained igneous rock
text:
high magnesium fine grained igneous rock

The concept high magnesium fine grained igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/High_Magnesium_Fine_Grained_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->high magnesium fine grained igneous rock
Definition:
fine-grained igneous rock that contains unusually high concentration of MgO. For rocks that contain greater than 52 percent silica, MgO must be greater than 8 percent. For rocks containing less than 52 percent silica, MgO must be greater than 12 percent.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
phonolitoid

The concept phonolitoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Phonolitoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->phonolitoid
Definition:
Fine grained igneous rock than contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals, between 10 and 60 percent feldspathoid mineral in the QAPF fraction and has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio less than 0.5. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 11 and 12, and TAS field Ph.
Alternate labels:
phonolitic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
rhyolitoid

The concept rhyolitoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Rhyolitoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->rhyolitoid
Definition:
fine_grained_igneous_rock consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar, with minor plagioclase and biotite, in a microcrystalline, cryptocrystalline or glassy groundmass. Flow texture is common. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2 and 3 or chemically in TAS Field R as rhyolite. QAPF normative definition is based on modal mineralogy thus: less than 90 percent mafic minerals, between 20 and 60 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction, and ratio of plagioclse to total feldspar is less than 0.65.
Alternate labels:
rhyolitic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
tephritoid

The concept tephritoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Tephritoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->tephritoid
Definition:
Fine grained igneous rock than contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals, between 10 and 60 percent feldspathoid mineral in the QAPF fraction and has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio greater than 0.5. Includes rocks classified in QAPF field 13 and 14 or chemically in TAS field U1 as basanite or tephrite.
Alternate labels:
tephritic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
trachytoid

The concept trachytoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Trachytoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->trachytoid
Definition:
Fine grained igneous rock than contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals, less than 10 percent feldspathoid mineral and less than 20 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction and has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio less than 0.65. Mafic minerals typically include amphibole or mica; typically porphyritic. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 6, 7 and 8 (with subdivisions) or chemically in TAS Field T as trachyte or latite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
fragmental igneous rock

The concept fragmental igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Fragmental_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->Rock->igneous rock->fragmental igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
pyroclastic rock
Definition:
Igneous rock in which greater than 75 percent of the rock consists of fragments produced as a result of igneous rock-forming process. Includes pyroclastic rocks, autobreccia associated with lava flows and intrusive breccias. Excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes (see Tuffite)

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
pyroclastic rock

The concept pyroclastic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Pyroclastic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->Rock->igneous rock->fragmental igneous rock->pyroclastic rock
Definition:
Fragmental igneous rock that consists of greater than 75 percent fragments produced as a direct result of eruption or extrusion of magma from within the earth onto its surface. Includes autobreccia associated with lava flows and excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
glass rich igneous rock

The concept glass rich igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Glass_Rich_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->glass rich igneous rock
Definition:
Igneous rock that contains greater than 50 percent massive glass.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
hypabyssal intrusive rock

The concept hypabyssal intrusive rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Hypabyssal_Intrusive_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->hypabyssal intrusive rock
Definition:
Igneous rocks formed by crystallisation close to the Earth’s surface, characterized by more rapid cooling than plutonic setting to produce generally fine-grained intrusive igneous rock, commonly associated with co-magmatic volcanic rocks.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
intermediate composition igneous rock

The concept intermediate composition igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Intermediate_Composition_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->intermediate composition igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
andesite, dioritoid
Definition:
Igneous rock with between 52 and 63 percent SiO2.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
andesite

The concept andesite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Andesite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->intermediate composition igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->fine grained igneous rock->andesite
Definition:
Fine-grained igneous rock with less than 20 percent quartz and less than 10 percent feldspathoid minerals in the QAPF fraction, in which the ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is greater 0.65. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field O2 as andesite. Basalt and andesite, which share the same QAPF fields, are distinguished chemically based on silica content, with basalt defined to contain less than 52 weight percent silica. If chemical data are not available, the color index is used to distinguish the categories, with basalt defined to contain greater than 35 percent mafic minerals by volume or greater than 40 percent mafic minerals by weight. Typically consists of plagioclase (frequently zoned from labradorite to oligoclase), pyroxene, hornblende and/or biotite. Fine grained equivalent of dioritic rock.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
dioritoid

The concept dioritoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Dioritoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->intermediate composition igneous rock->dioritoid
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock with M less than 90, consisting of intermediate plagioclase, commonly with hornblende and often with biotite or augite. Plagioclase to total feldspar ratio is greater that 0.65, and anorthite content of plagioclase is less than 50 percent. Less than 10 percent feldspathoid mineral and less than 20 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 (and their subdivisions).

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
phaneritic igneous rock

The concept phaneritic igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Phaneritic_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock
Immediately narrower concepts:
anorthositic rock, aplite, dioritoid, foid dioritoid, foid gabbroid, foid syenitoid, foidolite, gabbroid, granitoid, hornblendite, pegmatite, peridotite, pyroxenite, quartz rich igneous rock, syenitoid
Definition:
Igneous rock in which the framework of the rock consists of individual crystals that can be discerned with the unaided eye. Bounding grain size is on the order of 32 to 100 microns. Igneous rocks with ‘exotic’ composition are excluded from this concept.
Alternate labels:
coarse grained crystalline igneous rock, plutonic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
anorthositic rock

The concept anorthositic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Anorthositic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->anorthositic rock
Definition:
Anorthositic rock term invented to label the combined QAPF fields 10, 10*, and 10’, in order to construct hierarchy in this vocabulary.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
aplite

The concept aplite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Aplite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->aplite
Definition:
Light coloured crystalline rock, characterized by a fine grained allotriomorphic-granular (aplitic, saccharoidal or xenomorphic) texture; typically granitic composition, consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and sodic plagioclase.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
dioritoid

The concept dioritoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Dioritoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->intermediate composition igneous rock->dioritoid
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock with M less than 90, consisting of intermediate plagioclase, commonly with hornblende and often with biotite or augite. Plagioclase to total feldspar ratio is greater that 0.65, and anorthite content of plagioclase is less than 50 percent. Less than 10 percent feldspathoid mineral and less than 20 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 (and their subdivisions).

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
foid dioritoid

The concept foid dioritoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Foid_Dioritoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->foid dioritoid
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock in which M is less than 90, the plagioclase to total feldspar ratio is greater than 0.5, feldspathoid minerals form 10-60 percent of the QAPF fraction, plagioclase has anorthite content less than 50 percent. These rocks typically contain large amounts of mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 13 and 14.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
foid gabbroid

The concept foid gabbroid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Foid_Gabbroid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->foid gabbroid
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock in which M is less than 90, the plagioclase to total feldspar ratio is greater than 0.5, feldspathoids form 10-60 percent of the QAPF fraction, and plagioclase has anorthite content greater than 50 percent. These rocks typically contain large amounts of mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 13 and 14.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
foid syenitoid

The concept foid syenitoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Foid_Syenitoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->foid syenitoid
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock with M less than 90, contains between 10 and 60 percent feldspathoid mineral in the QAPF fraction, and has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio less than 0.5. Includes QAPF fields 11 and 12.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
foidolite

The concept foidolite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Foidolite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->foidolite
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline rock containing more than 60 percent feldspathoid minerals in the QAPF fraction. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 15

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
gabbroid

The concept gabbroid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Gabbroid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->gabbroid
Immediately narrower concepts:
gabbroic rock, monzogabbroic rock
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock that contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals, and up to 20 percent quartz or up to 10 percent feldspathoid in the QAPF fraction. The ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is greater than 0.65, and anorthite content of the plagioclase is greater than 50 percent. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 and their subdivisions.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
gabbroic rock

The concept gabbroic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Gabbroic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->gabbroid->Rock->igneous rock->basic igneous rock->gabbroic rock
Definition:
Gabbroid that has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio greater than 0.9 in the QAPF fraction. Includes QAPF fields 10*, 10, and 10’. This category includes the various categories defined in LeMaitre et al. (2002) based on the mafic mineralogy, but apparently not subdivided based on the quartz/feldspathoid content.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
monzogabbroic rock

The concept monzogabbroic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Monzogabbroic_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->gabbroid->monzogabbroic rock
Definition:
Gabbroid with a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio between 0.65 and 0.9. QAPF field 9, 9 prime and 9 asterisk

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
granitoid

The concept granitoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Granitoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid
Immediately narrower concepts:
alkali feldspar granite, granite, granodiorite, tonalite
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and/or plagioclase. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2, 3, 4 and 5 as alkali feldspar granite, granite, granodiorite or tonalite.
Alternate labels:
granitic rock

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
alkali feldspar granite

The concept alkali feldspar granite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Alkali_Feldspar_Granite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->alkali feldspar granite
Definition:
Granitic rock that has a plagioclase to total feldspar ratio less than 0.1. QAPF field 2.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
granite

The concept granite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Granite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->granite
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and plagioclase (typically sodic) in variable amounts, usually with biotite and/or hornblende. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 3.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
granodiorite

The concept granodiorite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Granodiorite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->granodiorite
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting essentially of quartz, sodic plagioclase and lesser amounts of alkali feldspar with minor hornblende and biotite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 4.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
tonalite

The concept tonalite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Tonalite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->granitoid->tonalite
Definition:
Granitoid consisting of quartz and intermediate plagioclase, usually with biotite and amphibole. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 5; ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is greater than 0.9.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
hornblendite

The concept hornblendite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Hornblendite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->ultramafic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->hornblendite
Definition:
Ultramafic rock that consists of greater than 40 percent hornblende plus pyroxene and has a hornblende to pyroxene ratio greater than 1. Includes olivine hornblendite, olivine-pyroxene hornblendite, pyroxene hornblendite, and hornblendite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
pegmatite

The concept pegmatite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Pegmatite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->pegmatite
Definition:
Exceptionally coarse grained crystalline rock with interlocking crystals; most grains are 1cm or more diameter; composition is generally that of granite, but the term may refer to the coarse grained facies of any type of igneous rock;usually found as irregular dikes, lenses, or veins associated with plutons or batholiths.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
peridotite

The concept peridotite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Peridotite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->ultramafic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->peridotite
Definition:
Ultramafic rock consisting of more than 40 percent (by volume) olivine with pyroxene and/or amphibole and little or no feldspar. commonly altered to serpentinite. Includes rocks defined modally in the ultramafic rock classification as dunite, harzburgite, lherzolite, wehrlite, olivinite, pyroxene peridotite, pyroxene hornblende peridotite or hornblende peridotite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
pyroxenite

The concept pyroxenite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Pyroxenite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->ultramafic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->pyroxenite
Definition:
Ultramafic phaneritic igneous rock composed almost entirely of one or more pyroxenes and occasionally biotite, hornblende and olivine. Includes rocks defined modally in the ultramafic rock classification as olivine pyroxenite, olivine-hornblende pyroxenite, pyroxenite, orthopyroxenite, clinopyroxenite and websterite.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
quartz rich igneous rock

The concept quartz rich igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Quartz_Rich_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->Rock->igneous rock->acidic igneous rock->quartz rich igneous rock
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock that contains less than 90 percent mafic minerals and contains greater than 60 percent quartz in the QAPF fraction.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
syenitoid

The concept syenitoid  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Syenitoid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->phaneritic igneous rock->syenitoid
Definition:
Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock with M less than 90, consisting mainly of alkali feldspar and plagioclase; minor quartz or nepheline may be present, along with pyroxene, amphibole or biotite. Ratio of plagioclase to total feldspar is less than 0.65, quartz forms less than 20 percent of QAPF fraction, and feldspathoid minerals form less than 10 percent of QAPF fraction. Includes rocks classified in QAPF fields 6, 7 and 8 and their subdivisions.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
plutonic rock

The concept plutonic rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Plutonic_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->plutonic rock
Definition:
Instrusive igneous rock formed by crystallisation of magma far enough below Earth surface that complete crystallization of magma bodies forms holocrystalline medium to coarse grained igneous rock, wall rocks generally do not include volcanic products related to the magma, and some contact metamorphism is tyypically developed at intrusive contacts.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
porphyry

The concept porphyry  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Porphyry  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->porphyry
Definition:
Igneous rock that contains conspicuous phenocrysts in a finer grained groundmass; groundmass itself may be phaneritic or fine-grained.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
ultrabasic igneous rock

The concept ultrabasic igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Ultrabasic_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Rock->igneous rock->ultrabasic igneous rock
Definition:
Igneous rock with less than 45 percent SiO2.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Rock and sediment materials vocabulary
text:
ultramafic igneous rock

The concept ultramafic igneous rock  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/Ultramafic_Igneous_Rock  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/rocksediment/1.0/rocksedimentvocabulary
